class.name: AudioPlayer1D
class.description: Plays audio that dampens with distance from the screen center or distance from the active [AudioListener1D] node. See also [AudioStreamPlayer] to play a sound non-positionally. [b]Note:[/b] Hiding an [AudioPlayer1D] node does not disable its audio output. To temporarily disable an [AudioPlayer1D]'s audio output, set [member volume_db] to a very low value like [code]-200[/code] (which isn't audible to human hearing).

method.name: get_stream_playback
method.description: Returns the [AudioStreamPlayback] object associated with this [AudioPlayer1D].

method.name: play
method.description: Plays the audio from the given position [code]from_position[/code], in seconds.

method.name: seek
method.description: Sets the position from which audio will be played, in seconds.

members.member: Dampens audio over distance with this as an exponent.
If [code]true[/code], audio plays when added to scene tree.

Distance at which the audio balance is 75% to one side. Default is 100 pixels. Set this value to 0 if audio should only be played from one side at a time. Set this to a negative value to have the audio balance be multiplied by the [Viewport] width. The audio balance is controlled by a pseudo-sigmoid function with this added to the denominator.
Bus on which this audio is playing.
Maximum distance from which audio is still hearable.
The maximum number of sounds this node can play at the same time. Playing additional sounds after this value is reached will cut off the oldest sounds.
The pitch and the tempo of the audio, as a multiplier of the audio sample's sample rate.
If [code]true[/code], the playback is paused. You can resume it by setting [code]stream_paused[/code] to [code]false[/code].

signal.name: finished
signal.description: Emitted when the audio stops playing.
